title: tRNA synthetase gene detector
description: This feature specifically detects genes encoding tRNA synthetases (aminoacyl-tRNA ligases) and related components across bacterial genomes. It shows particularly strong activation for phenylalanine-tRNA ligase genes (pheS/pheT), which appear in multiple examples with consistent activation patterns. The feature typically fires at the beginning or within these genes, suggesting it may detect specific sequence motifs in their coding regions. This pattern is consistent across diverse bacterial phyla, including Firmicutes and Spirochetes, indicating evolutionary conservation of these essential protein synthesis components. The biological significance relates to protein translation machinery, specifically the enzymes that attach amino acids to their cognate tRNAs.
